education4.name: Msc. Business strategy, leadership and change

data: Competitive strategy: This course aimed to present theorical and practical issues in competitive strategy, but also to enhance business planning skills and strategic thinking. The course had various business case scenario and a coursework (case study) where a business was analysed and a strategy proposed for this business.

Leadership: This course introduced several theories of leadership and the impact on projects & businesses. The course had several case studies and a coursework focused on analysing the leadership style and background of Mr. Ren Zhengfei (Huawei)

Strategic change: This course aimed to analyse the processes used for strategic change and the impact on human resources. The course had several case studies and a coursework focused on the case of Zappos, an online shoe retailer using holacracy.

Business models: This course was focused on analysing business models, value proposition and strategic thinking. The course presented the various points of a business model (Customers, Customer relationships, distribution channels, value proposition, key activities & resources, key partners, costs and revenues). A group coursework was done and aimed to simulate the creation of a small business and present it to investors (represented by the lecturers & classmates).

International Marketing: This course aimed to present marketing environment and risk factors in a global context. The lecture analysed the effects of globalisation, international structures and ethics on marketing strategies. A coursework was done on a small business (bluevalet): this case study aimed to analyse the company, and the macro environment of the UK to propose an implementation strategy in a new market (UK).

Business Economics: This course presented the key concepts and principles of micro and macro economics and many economic problems (such as globalization, employment, environment, technological progress, and inequalities). A coursework was done that analysed how technological progress can impact unemployment and standards of living in the long term.

content.data:
My MSc thesis is under writing (until August 2020).
This thesis aims to analyse how AI can impact positively or negatively competitive intelligence

Artificial intelligence and intelligent agents

content.data:
This thesis aimed to analyse and compare multiple tools used in NLP (natural language processing) for sentiment analysis.

More information can be found under the project tab, “Sentiment analysis in customer reviews”.
ESME Sudria is a French engineering school that delivers a regulated diploma “Ingénieur diplomé” after 5 years studying. It is an equivalent to a Master of Science in engineering or a MSc.

This school is providing courses across various domain of engineering (Mechanics, Energy, Signal processing, Electronics, Computer science & software engineering). During the 4th year, I specialized in Software Engineering & computer science.

The school aims to promote “managerial employees” and provide several non-engineering courses (sociology & psychology, project management, French law, business analysis, startup creation/ entrepreneurship, quality management & sustainable development. At last, an internship is mandatory each year of study.

Master courses took place in Ivry-sur-Seine (Paris). This part of the curriculum was technical and theoretical in 4th year, but when went technical when specializing in 4th year second semester and 5th year.

This final year project (close to a thesis) was aiming to use image processing methodologies to extract the aorta from MRI images.

More information on this project can be found under the project tab, “Medical image segmentation”.
